name: Jsdoc2-template-bootstrap
body:
# Abstract
This template makes your JavaScript document more beautiful and functional.
It works on [JsDoc2](http://code.google.com/p/jsdoc-toolkit/).

# Features

* [Overview](https://github.com/OrgaChem/JsDoc2-Template-Bootstrap/blob/master/docs/overview.png)
* [Beautiful code preview](https://github.com/OrgaChem/JsDoc2-Template-Bootstrap/blob/master/docs/code.png)
* [Inheritance tree](https://github.com/OrgaChem/JsDoc2-Template-Bootstrap/blob/master/docs/inheritance.png)
* [Functional member documentation](https://github.com/OrgaChem/JsDoc2-Template-Bootstrap/blob/master/docs/member.png)

# Install

> To produce output files you must use a template to format the generated documentation. Use the `-t` option to specify which template you wish to use. 

```java -jar jsrun.jar app/run.js myscripts/ -t=templates/jsdoc```

See JsDoc [document](http://code.google.com/p/jsdoc-toolkit/wiki/CommandlineOptions#Using_a_Template), if you want more information.
tagline: Beautiful Template with Bootstrap for JsDoc2.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
